newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish Lentex sets issue price at PLN 21.5 PLN.
newsitem.headline: Polish Lentex sets issue price at PLN 21.5 PLN.

text.p: Polish carpet maker Lentex SA has set the issue price of its 1.5-million-share initial public offering at 21.5 zlotys per share, the company said in a statement on Thursday.
The firm had previously said the price would fall between 18 and 23 zlotys.

Lentex also said it had signed an underwriting agreement with the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) and Bank Handlowy SA, with each underwriting 750,000 shares for a stand-by fee of 322,500 zlotys each.
Lentex, which seeks a main market listing, is offering 900,000 shares in a large-investor tranche from January 28 to January 30 and 500,000 shares in a retail tranche from January 28 to February 5.
It is also offering employees and management 100,000 shares from January 28 to February 5.
The firm netted 11.2 million zlotys on sales of 150.2 million zlotys in 1995.
It expects to net 12.1 million zlotys this year on sales of 149.6 million zlotys.
